label: 両
対訳語: A unit of value for coinage
本: Edo and Paris:  Urban Life and the State in the Early Modern Era . Cornell University Press . 1994
著者: McClain, James L.  and Wakita Osamu
説明文: The standard gold coin issued by the shogunate, the koban (小判), was equivalent to one ryo in the early seventeenth century and contained almost exactly fifteen grams of gold, although it was periodically devalued thereafter; the shogunate fixed the exchange rate of 1 ryo of gold at 50 (later 60) monme (匁) of silver or 4 kan (貫) of copper coins (zeni 銭).
